ISSUE.TITLE: Exporting data should returns SQL types and not python types
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Summary When I export the result of a select, the primitive types returned are those of Python and not those of sql, booleans usually come as False/True rather than false/true. A summary of the issue and the browser/OS environment in which it occurs. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Select data from any table 2. Export the data. ### Technical details: * Redash Version: 7.0.0+b17535 (15c815fb) * Browser/OS: Chrome/Ubuntu * How did you install Redash:

COMMIT.MESSAGE: CSV: correctly serialize booleans and dates. Closes #3736, closes #2751.

CSV: correctly serialize booleans and dates. (#3841) * CSV: correctly serialize booleans and dates. Closes #3736, closes #2751. * pep8 fixes * Move column iteration to a helper function. * Use elif, as types are mutually exclusive. * Refactor parsing implementation. * Move the csv generation fucntion
